H0.text: Near a forest is where an osprey most likely lives, because ospreys are birds that eat fish.

H1.text: Near a marsh is where an osprey most likely lives, given that ospreys are birds that eat fish.

H2.text: Near a desert is where an osprey, a bird that eats fish, most likely lives.

H3.text: Near a prairie is where an osprey most likely lives, because ospreys are birds that eat fish.

A4.text: Birds, particularly waterfowl and waders use wetlands extensively.

A5.text: Many fishes have all or part of their life-cycle occurring within a wetland system.
